result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Ray Mellenthin

records.addlTxt: 10:09 AM Defendant Randall Ray Mellenthin in court.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Randall Ray Mellenthin.   The defendant pled guilty to the charge. Rights given. Court finds that he has entered his plea knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant guilty.   State is in compliance in victim rights law.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 10:10 am.

9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall Ray Mellenthin in court.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Randall Ray Mellenthin. State's offer is accepted.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:10 am.

The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 09:10 am.

DA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State; Defendant appeared in person, pro se; Defendant does not qualify for SPD; Court review Petition for Court Appted. Attorney; Court appoints an attorney, orders Defendant to repay $150.00/mo beginning on May 1, 2022; Court quashes warrant; Court sets AIA on May 12, 2022 at 9:10 a.m.; Court orders bonds reinstated as originally set

09:59 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin did not appear.    Bench warrant was requested and authorized to be issued on the defendants failure to appear.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender
Adjourned initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:41 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin appeared, pro se.  Call the PD office and see if he qualifies.  M  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 09:40 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is to submit to a breathalyzer at anytime requested by a law enforcement officer.      Defendant shall have no abusive, violent or otherwise disorderly contact with M.M.

01:16 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Randall Ray Mellenthin appeared, pro se by video from Clark county Jail.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 09:40 am.
